remarks: Lemma for ~ ostth2 , although it is just a simple statement about exponentials which does not involve any specifics of ~ ostth2 .  If a power is upper bounded by a linear term, the exponent must be less than one.  Or in big-O notation, ` n e. o ( A ^ n ) ` for any ` 1 < A ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 10-Sep-2014.)
statement:
ostth2lem1.1 $e |- ( ph -> A e. RR ) $.
ostth2lem1.2 $e |- ( ph -> B e. RR ) $.
ostth2lem1.3 $e |- ( ( ph /\ n e. NN ) -> ( A ^ n ) <_ ( n x. B ) ) $.
ostth2lem1 $p |- ( ph -> A <_ 1 ) $.
$d A n $.
$d B n $.
$d n ph $.
